remarks: No set ` A ` is equinumerous to its power set (Cantor's theorem), i.e. no function can map ` A ` it onto its power set.  Compare Theorem 6B(b) of [Enderton] p. 132.  For the equinumerosity version, see ~ canth2 . Note that ` A ` must be a set: this theorem does not hold when ` A ` is too large to be a set; see ~ ncanth for a counterexample.  (Use ~ nex if you want the form ` -. E. f f : A -onto-> ~P A ` .)  (Contributed by NM, 7-Aug-1994.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jun-2016.)
statement:
canth.1 $e |- A e. _V $.
canth $p |- -. F : A -onto-> ~P A $.
